title: Matchsafe, "Punch and Judy Puppet Theatre", 1894–95
markings: Lion passant, date letter, anchor, partially impressed maker's mark (D&Co?) all stamped on bezel. Lion passant, date letter stamped on reverse of lid. Rd 233329 stamped on left side.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular body, triangular lid, featuring raised decoration of Punch and Judy puppet show, with dog Toby in ruffled collar, performed on small, perspectival proscenium, a curtain hangs off the front, canted roof (lid) displays a coat of arms on pediment front. Lid hinged on side. Striker in recessed groove on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Punch and Judy Puppet Theatre", 1894–95.
1894–95. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-176.
